Thirsty Souls Mafia

Moderator: Konowa
Reviewed by: xReckonerx, LlamaFluff, Elmo



All was well in the quaint little town of Lynchburg. That is, until some mafiosos decided to kill the owner of the only bar in town. Now you have no beer!!! It is up to you to find out who turned this into a dry town.

Player List
1. DunhamgangerPine
2. Scott Brosius
3. AngryPidgeon
4. ProHawk
5. Demon CoreLupo
6. PMysterious
7. roflcopter
8. greygnarlRXK
9. Xelath
10. Red Coyoteak8
11. qwints
12. MonkeyMan576
13. ThAdmiralfish-riding-a-bike-2000

Death!Death!Die!
Spoiler:
ProHawk, Town Roleblocker, lynched Day 1
Scott Brosius, Town Mason, killed Night 1
AngryPidgeon, Mafia Goon, lynched Day 2
roflcopter, Vanilla Townie, killed Night 2

Game Rules
(Stolen from various sources)

Game Mechanics
1.) Votes must be bolded and in a form similar to Vote: Playername. If I do not see your vote, it will not count. Unvotes are nice but not required.
2.) Lynches require a majority of votes (50% of the living players +1). If a 50% + 1 majority is not reached by deadline no lynch occurs.
3.) No Lynches require only 50% of the vote to occur.
4.) If a lynch occurs, the game enters twilight and players may continue to talk in thread until it is locked and a death scene is posted. No votes/unvotes will count in twilight.
5.) Dead players cannot talk. Once you are killed/lynched do not post in thread. Not even a "bah!" post.
6.) All actions will be resolved using the Natural Action Resolution system.

Deadlines/Activity
7.) Each Day will have a two week deadline.
8.) I will consider deadline extensions on an individual basis.
9.) Treat this game as a commitment. If you are going to be V/LA please post in thread or send me a PM.
10.) Players must post every 72 hours (unless they have noted V/LA) or they will be prodded. Three total prods during the game will result in a replacement.
11.) If a player fails to pick up their prod and post in game within 24 hours they will be replaced.
12.) Each night will last approximately 72 hours, during which time all night actions must be submitted via PM.

General
13.) Have fun and be respectful to your fellow players.
14.) Do not speak about this game outside of the thread unless your role specifies that you may do so.
15.) Do not quote anything from the moderator that is said outside of this thread (including role PMs) or pretend to quote anything from the moderator. Paraphrasing is allowed but if you are questioning your paraphrase, run it by me first.
16.) If I make a mistake, please address your grievance in bold in thread or in PM. Please point out vote count errors in thread only.
17.) Do not edit posts. Do not use invisible text. Do not use small text.
18.) Green is my color. Do not use it.
19.) At least one person received the following PM:

Hello, XXX, and welcome to Mini Normal #1386 - Thirsty Souls Mafia!

You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special abilities. You win when all anti-town players have been eliminated.

The game thread is located here. Please confirm in thread.
Role PMs sent out. Day 1 will begin when eleven out of thirteen have confirmed.
/confirm
/confirm
/confirm
Looking for a replacement for fish-riding-a-bike-2000.
/confirm
/confirm
/confrm
confirmed
/confirm
/confirm
/confirm. I'd prefer to drink water so I have no need to worry about the only bar being gone at all.
/confirm

Day One begins now!

2. There is so much about it that doesn't feel right:
- The timing. He asked people to claim yesterday, but didn't claim himself.
- The convenience. He never stops a kill the entire game, but just at the end when it could make his claim seem more legit and make me look bad he stops a kill. Note this is the first time he was under any pressure to be lynched, and therefore the first time he would have felt the need to claim. Also note that by stopping a kill now it is still a mylo situation, so he doesn't lose a day.
- The reasoning. There are at least 2 glaring examples of targets that don't make any sense at all (me night 3, not demon core night 4), and in fact go completely against what he has said in this game, and his other targets also make little sense (dunham night 1, me for three nights in a row even though he hadn't stopped a kill by blocking me in the previous 2 nights).
- The role. Jks and Rbs in the same game (especially for the same side) are rare for a couple of reasons. Firstly they are very similar roles - why give 2 of basically the same role to town, one slightly more powerful than the other? Secondly the interaction between them is very tricky to define - which resolves first if they block each other, for example. Sometimes when a mod plans an rb and a jk in the same game they add a special clarification to their rules i.e. "role resolution is as follows bus driver>jail keeper>role blocker" or something like that.
- The power. Town has already had 2 masons and a role blocker flip, while scum has only flipped 2 goons (which are like vanilla townies of the scum team). If town also had a jail keeper it would be 4 power roles to the town and, assuming the godfather had some sort of ability like rolecop or maybe strongman, only 1 to the scum, which seems like a bit of a power imbalance to me.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

3. Yes I frankly think qwints should have been lynched by now based on the mountain of evidence against him, and I'm quite frustrated you and xelath (who chose so well yesterday) are dawdling so much today.

Thank you all for dealing with me during my first modding experience. I know I have things to work on. Timeliness being one. I am asking for critique.

I want to thank all of the replacements who came into this game. Without you, this game would have been a stick in the mud. I want to thank all of the original signups who finished.

This was an enjoyable experience for me. I plan on modding future games, next being a large normal (so if you want to /pre-in let me know). I said in the dead thread I would discuss reasoning behind setup. When I took an unfortunate hiatus from the site roughly a year and half ago the limit for mini's was twelve players. When I came back it was thirteen, and I did notice a difference in "common" setups. What I mean by this is that with the expansion to thirteen players I have noticed more and more setups being heavy on PRs on both sides. I wanted to try and do something different. Yes, it was -a bit- leaning on the mountanious side, but I think if ProHawk wasn't lynched D1 nor Scott killed N1 it would have been fun to see scum play against this. I have more thoughts, but it's Thanksgiving and the Redskins won so I need to drink to that.

Cheers!
